intro: Hieracium subcapillatum, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. It features bright yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, and its leaves are hairy and arranged in a rosette pattern. Hieracium subcapillatum is often found in disturbed habitats and can spread readily through rhizomes.
